Detailed Description

A function from , thus describing a parametrized surface in hyperspace

Author:
Helge Preuss <scout@hyperspace-travel.de>

double  tz,
double  tw 
) [virtual]

transforms a Surface
as I look at it, i think this could be optimized by making the transformation matrices static and only canging the corresponding entries... but how to make this beautifully, i don't know

Parameters:
thetaxy rotation around xy plane (z axis); ignored because 3D rotation takes care of it
thetaxz rotation around xz plane (y axis); ignored because 3D rotation takes care of it
thetaxw rotation around xw plane
thetayz rotation around xy plane (x axis); ignored because 3D rotation takes care of it
thetayw rotation around yw plane
thetazw rotation around zw plane
tx translation in x direction
ty translation in y direction
tz translation in z direction
tw translation in w direction

Vector< 4 > & Surface::normal [protected]

calculate normal to function at a given point in definition set
no further assumption is made than that f () is continuous
this function is not yet used anywhere, but i like it
